intro: Gnaphalium peregrinum, commonly known as the wandering feather grass, is a small annual herb native to southern Africa. It produces fluffy, white to pale yellow flower heads that are often mistaken for dandelion seeds. The plant has slender, branching stems and fine, thread-like leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and easily recognizable species within the Asteraceae family.
